Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: கண்ணிற்கு அணிகலம் கண்ணோட்டம் அஃதின்றேல் புண்ணென்று உணரப் படும்.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: Kind looks are the ornaments of the eyes; without these they will be considered (by the wise) to be merely two sores.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A split-screen portrait of a face.
Layered_Composition.Midground: On the left side, the eye is adorned with a beautiful, glowing light of kindness ('கண்ணோட்டம்'). This light is its true ornament ('அணிகலம்'). On the right side, the eye lacks this light of kindness ('அஃதின்றேல்'). As a result, it is not just plain, but is depicted as a painful, ugly wound or sore ('புண்').
Layered_Composition.Background: The background on the left is beautiful and serene. The background on the right is grotesque and unsettling, reflecting the state of the eye.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: The true ornament of the eye is benignity. Without it, an eye is not just an eye, but should be considered a wound.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The direct, shocking contrast between the eye adorned with light and the eye as a wound is the central concept. This is a literal interpretation of the Kural's powerful metaphor.
Art_Direction.Mood_and_Emotion: Contrasting, beautiful vs. grotesque, ornamental vs. wounded.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: Left side: Soft, beautiful, divine light. Right side: Harsh, sickly, medical lighting that makes the wound look painful and real.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A tight close-up on the face, split down the middle to show both eyes simultaneously.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, hyper-realistic, with one side beautiful and the other graphically realistic in its depiction of a sore.
Technical_Cues.Art_Genre: Hyperrealism, with a strong surreal and symbolic element.

Cultural_Anchors: Benignity as the Eye's Ornament ('கண்ணிற்கு அணிகலம் கண்ணோட்டம்')
Without it, an eye is a Wound ('புண் என்று உணரப்படும்')
